sentences.sContent: The river glittered in the sunlight.
She was blinded by the glitter and the glamour of her own life.
sentences.sCn: 她被自己生活的表面光耀所蒙蔽。

remMethod.val: g + litter(看做little， 小的) → 一闪一闪小星星 → 闪烁

trans.tranOther: to shine brightly with flashing points of light

trans.tranCn: 灿烂的光辉； 诱惑力， 魅力
trans.tranOther: You can use glitter to refer to superficial attractiveness or to the excitement connected with something
